column4: does anyone know if there's a bug setting system sounds under System->Preferences->Sound ??
i've set sounds for all the events and i don't hear them except for login and logout
are the other sound events pointing to a sound file? have you selected what file to play?
perhaps there's a log-file in /var/log that can help you?
i'll check that.  the funny thing is i can play any sound i select for an event but when the event occurs it doesn't play the sound

yeah, i think what you need to find out first is exactly where the problem occurs. is it that it tries to play the sound and that it doesn't work, or is it having trouble sensing the event. it might even be that the configuration program actually isn't writing what you want it to, to the conf-file.
correct but that's where my limited knowledge halts =(
it used to work fine in Dapper
hmm.. frankly I have no idea. it doesn't sound like a sound-problem, tough. i would guess that it has to do with the conf-file.
do u know where the conf-file is?
what is the program called that you are trying to alter? i would guess that it's somewhere under .gnome2
check this out, it's a pretty long thread tough. http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=205449
will do.  i appreciate ur help
